verses.roman:
te 'cyutaṁ prāptam ākarṇya
paurā jānapadā nṛpa
abhīyur muditās tasmai
gṛhītārhaṇa-pāṇayaḥ

synonyms: te—they; acyutam—Lord Kṛṣṇa; prāptam—arrived; ākarṇya—hearing; paurāḥ—the people of the city; jānapadāḥ—and of the villages; nṛpa—O King; abhīyuḥ—came forward; muditāḥ—joyful; tasmai—to Him; gṛhīta—holding; arhaṇa—offerings to present to Him; pāṇayaḥ—in their hands.
translation: Hearing that Lord Acyuta had arrived, O King, the residents of the cities and villages of Videha joyfully came forth to receive Him with offerings in their hands.
